summary: This is an email forwarding a news article about a Channel 4 News investigation alleging Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell committed offenses in Britain. The article reports that British police will review the new allegations and discusses the involvement of Prince Andrew and the handling of the investigation by UK authorities.

events.description: Prince Andrew admits to staying at Epstein's New York residence for four days in December 2010, claiming he flew there to end their friendship.

keyFacts: A Channel 4 News investigation alleges Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell sexually abused, trafficked, and groomed multiple women and girls in Britain over a period of years.
The Metropolitan Police Service will review the new allegations, having previously dropped an investigation into Epstein in 2019, stating it was not the appropriate authority.
Prince Andrew is implicated in the scandal due to his ties to Epstein, including staying at his New York home in 2010, which led to him stepping back from public duties in 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell in August 2019 while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges; the death was ruled a suicide.
Ghislaine Maxwell was in jail awaiting trial in the United States on sex trafficking charges at the time of this article's publication.
